Name: Queers without Beers Voluntary Contributions
Description: An evening to meet up with others without the stress of having to drink loads as well. A social space for queers of all persuasions that doesn't revolve around booze. We are very excited to be running this event in collaboration with LGBT London Friend. These events are friendly and informal. Don’t be daunted by meeting new people. If you want someone to meet you before going to the venue just email laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk. We will arrange for another member to meet you and introduce you to the group. We ask for a voluntary contribution of £3 towards the running costs of the group. This includes meetup fees, printing and promotion.

Name: SOBER SPRINT – TAKE A MONTH OFF BOOZE
Description:
TAKE A MONTH OFF ALCOHOL AT ANY TIME

Whether your long term goal is to to cut down or quit, a Sober Sprint, or a Month Off Booze (MOB) can help you reset your relationship with alcohol.

JOIN OUR GUIDED ONLINE PROGRAMME TO SUPPORT AND INSPIRE YOUR SOBER SPRINT

Nearly 300 people have taken part in this programme so far, many as part of Dry July, Dryathlon, Go Sober for October, or Dry January campaigns. Happy Mobbers are still part of our online community getting – and giving – further support and advice.

“Thank you Club Soda for your consistently helpful, creative, and inspiring daily emails. You’ve thought of absolutely everything!” Samantha

“I’m so happy I’ve joined the MOB – it really has given me the motivation to stick at it.  I was so fed up with the morning after regrets and the ‘this is the last time’ collapses… I am already sleeping so much better.” Germane

DESIGNED BY CLUB SODA AND OUR EXPERT PSYCHOLOGIST HELEN O’CONNOR

The four week Sober Sprint online course will help you to:

  • develop a better understanding of your drinking personality

  • discover the things that trigger your drinking, and help you cope with them

  • track the benefits of being without alcohol for a month

  • learn about being in social situations without drinking

  • learn how to deal with persistent, drink pushing mates

  • reflect on your progress throughout your sober month, and

  • decide on your long term drinking goals.

DAILY EMAILS, EXERCISES, VIDEOS

The Sober Sprint programme includes:

  • 30 daily emails ( 8 regular Club Soda motivational emails, and the online goal setting and progress tracking tools)

  • exercises and tasks to help you manage your dry month

  • a private online library of information and advice

  • 6 hours of video content with the Club Soda team and special guests

  • 4 downloadable e-booklets (as pdf files)

  • more than 40 non-alcoholic drink suggestions and reviews

  • a supportive private Facebook community of over 1,400 people changing their drinking together

  • ongoing anytime access to all the materials, still available after you have completed your programme.

You can start this programme at any time

After a successful Dry January MOB in 2016, we launched the programme as an “anytime” course – so you can start it on any day of the year. And we’ve changed the name from MOB to Sober Sprint.

Your Sober Sprint programme will start the day after you have paid for the course, and last for 4 weeks, with lifetime access to the private library and online community.

Price: Only £35 for the whole month’s programme with lifetime access!

Click on the Add to Basket button to join.

You can pay with debit card, credit card or PayPal, using our safe and secure online shop.

If you are buying from outside of the UK, PayPal and Stripe will automatically convert the price into your local currency (on 1st March 2018, £35 was approximately €39, $48 in USA, $62 Canadian and $62 Australian; do always check the actual price though as these will change each day!)

Who leads the programme?

The Sober Sprint programme has been developed by Helen O’Connor, a UK chartered psychologist with experience and training in areas such as health behaviour change, sports psychology, and addiction, and Laura and Jussi from Club Soda, who both have personal experience of changing their drinking – which is why they set up Club Soda. You can read more about the Club Soda team here.

You will also meet some of our special guest writers and webinar experts during the month, from people who have been there and done that, to some of Club Soda’s expert members, such as nutritionists and life coaches.

 

LONG TERM BENEFITS OF A SOBER SPRINT

Our first ever MOB/Sober Sprint programme took place in October 2015. Six months later (May 2016) we asked people from the first programme how they were doing now, half a year after their sober month. Everyone who responded said they were drinking less than they did before (most said they were drinking “much less”), and that their health and general wellbeing were also better. Some had lower blood pressure and had lost weight. Here are quotes from two members showing the benefits you can get from completing the programme:

Before the MOB I’d done a couple of months of counting units and sticking within the government’s old guidelines for men but it felt a struggle and it wasn’t clear that I would be able to stick at it. Now I don’t notice anymore that I don’t drink at home and can pace myself when out on ordinary evenings out. I sleep much better and have much better skin but I haven’t lost weight and haven’t managed to shake off a cold any better than before.

I have now been sober for 32 days. My blood pressure has normalized and I sleep better and I have lost 10 lbs. Thanks.

DOING A DRY JANUARY, GOING SOBER FOR OCTOBER?

A Sober Sprint is excellent additional support if you are doing a sober month for charity, and feel like you are finding it difficult. The Sober Sprint programme will take you through your dry month (whether January or any other month!), what you might be feeling at the start, halfway through, and towards the end of your challenge. And we will give you many tools and tips to help you successfully reach your goals.

If you have any questions, or if online payment is not possible for you, please email Laura at laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we’ll think of something else!
Purchase note: Make sure you let us know which email address you want us to use if it is different to the one you may be using for Paypal.

Name: MINDFUL DRINKING – 8 WEEK COURSE TO CHANGE YOUR HABITS
Description:
Mindful drinking is an 8 week online course helping you achieve your drinking goals, whether you want to cut down, stop for a bit, or quit alcohol for good. Here are just two quotes from the nearly 400 Club Soda members who have completed the course and reduced their drinking:

I met my goals with the occasional excess but felt in control and that I can maintain my goals each week. Looking forward I think I can reduce further. John I wasn’t sure I was able to cut down, and am very pleased that I can and I have. Stell

CUT DOWN OR QUIT ALCOHOL – IT IS ALL ABOUT MINDFUL DRINKING

This mindful drinking course is aimed at people who want to change their alcohol habits. You may be drinking a few glasses of wine every day, or binge at weekends. Either way, if you feel that your alcohol consumption is higher than you’d like it to be, this course will help you to quit or moderate. Note that this course is not recommended for physically dependent drinkers.

BASED ON BEHAVIOUR CHANGE SCIENCE

Powered by behaviour change science, the mindful drinking course will give you all the tools and techniques that you need to change your drinking habits. It includes 4 weeks of stimulating and practical emails that will help you understand your drinking and how you can go about changing your relationship with alcohol, followed by another 4 weeks of practice and email revision along with prompts to consolidate your hard work. As part of this course you will become part of the Club Soda community. A group of like-minded individuals changing their drinking together and boosting your chances of success. The 8 week course costs only £35. Click on the Add to Basket button to join. You can pay by debit card, credit card or PayPal, using our secure online shop. If you are buying from outside of the UK, PayPal and Stripe will automatically convert the price into your local currency (on 1st March 2018, £35 was approximately €39, $48 in USA, $62 Canadian and $62 Australian; do always check the actual price though as these will change each day!) PLEASE NOTE that you will receive the daily emails into the email account that you use in our online shop, but you can tell us if you want to receive them at a different email address.

ONLINE EMAIL PROGRAMME

What you will get in this email programme:
  • 56 daily emails, taking you through the tools and techniques to help you change your drinking
  • Access to the Club Soda community, where you can share your challenge with others doing the same
You can join the mindful drinking course on any day – you will begin receiving the emails on the day after you make your payment (unless you pay very late in the day, then it may be the day after…). If you haven’t received the email, please check your spam folder first, as sometimes these messages can be mistaken for spam. If you still can’t find the email, please email us at jussi@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we’ll look into it.

Who wrote the course?

Dr Jussi Tolvi is a social scientist with expertise in alcohol and behaviour change, and a moderate drinker. Laura Willoughby MBE is the founder of Club Soda, she gave up drinking four years ago. They have used their own knowledge, and the experiences of Club Soda members to develop this course.

WHAT PEOPLE HAVE SAID ABOUT MINDFUL DRINKING

Club Soda has been an enormous support for me during the last 4 weeks. I have looked forward to the emails & it has been uncanny how they seem to be exactly relevant to my experience. Karen The emails have helped me think about my habits / lifestyle so very much. I am trying to cut down but have just had a weekend away skiing where I failed miserably on a successful day. I only half believe in myself but I am loving the emails each day and will probably sign up again. The triggers have been the most insightful. Thank you for your help. I am not a lost cause yet! Louise I am much more aware of my drinking habits/triggers & behaviors since doing this course. I plan to continue to use the tools provided in the course to moderate my drinking and potentially even stop altogether as I start to accept I don’t ‘need’ to drink. Gill

THE MINDFUL DRINKING COURSE CONTENTS

Your daily emails will cover different topics each day, including:

  • The 5 stages of behaviour change
  • Assessing your current drinking habits
  • Understanding habits
  • Behaviour change and nudges
  • Goals and planning
  • Tracking progress
  • Decision-making and biases
  • Social Support
  • Distractions
  • Swapping old habits for new ones
  • Rewards
  • Associations
  • Motivation
  • Self-control
  • Willpower
  • Commitment and confidence
  • Guilt, shame and other emotions
  • How to keep going for the longer term?
  • And much more!
Purchase note: Make sure you let us know which email address you want us to use if it is different to the one you may be using for Paypal.

Name: Pay What You Want - Glass
Short description: Club Soda is a Pay What You Want movement. This means that we rely on donations for nearly everything we do: from our weekly webinars to campaigning for better drinks in your local pub.
Description:
Club Soda is a Pay What You Want movement. This means that we rely on donations for nearly everything we do, from our weekly webinars to campaigning for better low and no alcohol drinks in your local pub. We do this so that everyone can benefit from what we do. Our members save on average £200 a month by changing their drinking habits. You can help us be investing a little bit of that back into this vibrant and supportive movement. The payment will automatically be taken from your credit/debit card or PayPal account - or if you are in the UK, you can set up a standing order from your bank account. IMPORTANT:
  • For credit/debit cards payments using Stripe, you will have to use the "Monthly payment" option at checkout, not the regular Stripe option (it is further down the list of payment options).
  • For PayPal payments, please click the "Enable Automatic Payments" checkbox when making your payment.
  • You can cancel at any time. If you are going through a difficult time, you can also suspend your payments, for up to 90 days at a time, and then continue again.

Name: Wholesome AF Sweater from Birdsong
Description:
‘Wholesome AF’ Hand Painted Organic Sweatshirt

£65.00

Slightly cropped, mock neck sweatshirt in 100% organic cotton. Super soft lining inside, hand painted ‘Wholesome AF’ sass on the outside. Dropped shoulder, and loose, ultra comfortable fit. Hand-painted in detail by women at Mohila Creations. Mohila are a group of migrant mothers based in Tower Hamlets, London. Roksana and the gang practise their fine painting for Birdsong while their children attend the local school. They are paid a living wage for the work they do.
Birdsong are a fashion brand for people who expect more from their wardrobes.  We work on a promise of “no sweatshops & no photoshop”

You can buy this direct from Birdsong - new customers get £5 off.

Name: Birmingham Lunch - October 20th
Description:
Join us for our famous Birmingham Lunch. We take over the Board Room in the Cosy Club and try and hide our desserts from founder Laura!

Saturday October 20th

12.30pm

Cosy Club, Bennets Hill, Birmingham.

As this is a larger social than normal the costs include the two-course party menu (don't worry, as you can see Cosy Club are great for adapting to vegans and those with special dietary needs) as well as our admin fee. You can decide on dessert and drinks on the day! Club Soda socials are designed to let you meet other members and practice the important art of meeting new people and socialising sober. Whether you are cutting down or going alcohol-free these dry socials will help you develop new skills that are key to changing your habits and also allow you to meet others a little further along the journey than you. Don't be nervous. They really are friendly, but if you are unsure just drop Laura an email and we can arrange for someone to meet you in advance. We charge a non-refundable £5 charge for you to book your place. This helps pay for our admin costs and tax. Some event we also charge for the lunch up front and add the admin fee to this. In these cases, we will refund the lunch portion of your ticket if you cancel the Monday before the event.

Name: Brunch with Butch - October 6th, London
Description:
Club Soda volunteer admin Butch is over from the states for a few days - come and join him at our monthly London lunch.

12.30pm

Brasserie Blanc Southbank

Saturday 6th October 2018

£25

The price includes 3 course set menu meal and service plus our admin charge (you will get a link to preorder your food nearer the event). All drinks to be paid for  separately on the day.
Where possible we try to create real-world opportunities for our members to meet, to bring our community closer together and to help you practice the important art of meeting new people and socialising sober. Whether you are cutting down or going alcohol-free, these dry socials will help you develop new skills that are key to changing drinking habits - plus it’s also a great opportunity to get a little inspiration from members who are further along the journey than you. Club Soda lunches are friendly and informal, so don’t be daunted. There is an opportunity to chat to people going beforehand in the Facebook group and if you want someone to meet you before going to the venue, just email laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we will arrange for another member to meet you and introduce you to the group. We charge a non-refundable £5 charge for you to book your place. This helps pay for our admin costs and tax. Some event we also charge for the lunch up front and add the admin fee to this. In these cases, we will refund the lunch portion of your ticket if you cancel the Monday before the event.

Name: London Pride Picnic- 11th August
Description:
Come and meet Laura and Ali after running the Pride 10k (we are planning to make good time and the race starts at 11 am)
Janet will be coordinating the picnic aspect - but the key details are:
  • Bring food for you and if you have a speciality dish bring enough to share
  • Something to sit on!
  • Bring your favourite AF drink and be prepared to share
The Picnic will be at the end of the race which will be at the Molesworth Gate at the Hackney Wick end of the park (10 mins walk from Hackney Wick station)
Hackney Wick is on the overground and can be accessed from the Victoria Line at Highbury and Islington and from the central Line at Stratford. (If you are looking for a postcode for journey planner use Victoria Park Harriers, St Augustine's Hall, Cadogan Terrace, London E9 5EG)
If you fancy racing too then you can sign-up here https://priderun10k.org

Saturday 11th August

12.00pm- 4.00pm

Molesworth Gate- Victoria Park

E9 5EG

Name: Lunch and Walk – 19th August – Dollis, Mutton, Hampstead
Description:
Join CS member Ali for this walk from High Barnet to Hampstead. WALK DETAILS

Distance: 10 Miles

Meeting point: High Barnet Tube – 10:45 for 11 am start

End point: Hampstead Tube

Eating: This walk isn’t blessed with many options along the way. You may want to bring sandwiches and we’ll find somewhere to stop and eat. Terrain: Mostly flat, metalled pathways. This is a nature ramble of a walk, rich with tree spotting opportunities. We will join the Dollis Brook vale shortly after leaving High Barnet, and walk south through Totteridge, Woodside Park, and West Finchley, and see another side to suburban London. Skirting Finchley golf course, we’ll take in John Fowler’s Mill Hill Viaduct before turning eastwards at Hendon, joining Mutton Brook, which we will follow to Hampstead. From there you can either head up to East Finchley tube station, or continue onto Hampstead Heath, and leave via Hampstead tube. Where possible we try to create real-world opportunities for our members to meet, to bring our community closer together and to help you practice the important art of meeting new people and socialising sober. Whether you are cutting down or going alcohol-free, these dry socials will help you develop new skills that are key to changing drinking habits – plus it’s also a great opportunity to get a little inspiration from members who are further along the journey than you. Club Soda lunches are friendly and informal, so don’t be daunted. There is an opportunity to chat to people going beforehand in the Facebook group and if you want someone to meet you before going to the venue, just email laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we will arrange for another member to meet you and introduce you to the group. To book your place there is a non-refundable £5 charge to help with the cost of the organisation, admin costs and tax.

Name: Lunch and Walk – 16th September – Morden to Waddon Ponds
Description:
Join CS member Ali for this walk from Mordern to Waddon Ponds on Sunday 16th September.

Distance: 7 Miles

Meeting point: Morden Tube – 10:45 for 11 am start

End point: Waddon Railway Station

Lunch: TBC-  dog-friendly pub along the way

Terrain: Mostly flat, metalled pathways.

We’ll be following the River Wandle through established parkland and snatches of countryside to one of its sources at Waddon Ponds. This London river offers changing landscapes, from concrete straightjackets to rural meanders, and bypasses industrial estates and former mills and factories. The two areas of parkland at Morden Hall and Beddington Park provide relief from the surrounding suburbia. Where possible we try to create real-world opportunities for our members to meet, to bring our community closer together and to help you practice the important art of meeting new people and socialising sober. Whether you are cutting down or going alcohol-free, these dry socials will help you develop new skills that are key to changing drinking habits – plus it’s also a great opportunity to get a little inspiration from members who are further along the journey than you. Club Soda lunches are friendly and informal, so don’t be daunted. There is an opportunity to chat to people going beforehand in the Facebook group and if you want someone to meet you before going to the venue, just email laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we will arrange for another member to meet you and introduce you to the group. To book your place there is a non-refundable £5 charge to help with the cost of the organisation, admin costs and tax.

Name: Jolene Park Workshop - The Craving Brain
Description: We are really excited to announce this workshop with Jolene Park whilst she is visiting here from the states.   Jolene is well known in this community for her Ted Talk sharing her experience with gray area drinking — the kind of drinking where there’s no rock bottom, but you drink as a way to manage anxiety and then regret how much and how often you drink. Drawing from her expertise in functional nutrition she explains the importance of replenishing your neurotransmitters in a comprehensive and consistent way, especially if you want to get off the stopping and restarting drinking merry-go-round. Her workshop today is on The Craving Brain It doesn’t matter what your vice is — sugar, alcohol, obsessing/worrying, over-spending — this workshop will give you practical tools to build your inner resilience and nourish your nervous system in a comprehensive and consistent way. Join us for an interactive, experiential workshop on brain chemistry and cravings. Your rational mind wants the great beach body, but your emotional mind wants the cookie, or glass (or more) of wine. Drawing from research in functional nutrition, neuroscience and somatic (body) psychology you’ll discover how specific foods, movements and relaxation techniques can help you calm and regulate your body/mind in a healthy, sustainable way. Jolene is the founder of Healthy Discoveries — a corporate wellness company which provides coaching and training programs for high achieving business professionals who struggle with anxiety, stress and gray area drinking. The workshop will be followed by a lunch which Jolene will join us for. You can book these two events separately.

Name: London Lunch with Jolene Park
Description: Jolene is well known in this community for her Ted Talk sharing her experience with grey area drinking, she is running a workshop earlier in the day which you can see here. Following her workshop Jolene will join the regular Club Soda lunch. You don’t have to have been to the workshop to come to the lunch but this event has a limited capacity of 20 people. The price includes  3-courses from the set menu and as always we add our £5 admin fee and service charge on top. You can bring your own alcohol-free drinks to this venue. You will be asked to pre-order your meal a week in advance - so look out for the email! Name: York Social
Description: Where possible we try to create real-world opportunities for our members to meet, to bring our community closer together and to help you practice the important art of meeting new people and socialising sober. Whether you are cutting down or going alcohol-free, these dry socials will help you develop new skills that are key to changing drinking habits – plus it’s also a great opportunity to get a little inspiration from members who are further along the journey than you. Club Soda lunches are friendly and informal, so don’t be daunted. There is an opportunity to chat to people going beforehand in the Facebook group and if you want someone to meet you before going to the venue, just email laura@joinclubsoda.co.uk and we will arrange for another member to meet you and introduce you to the group.
